ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I developed my Spanish vocabulary and understanding. I learned subjunctive, imperative, perfect, and simple future tense verb conjugations. I also expanded my knowledge about Hispanic cultures.
I learned about the gaps in my knowledge of the Spanish Language such as direct and indirect pronouns.
Comfortability speaking Spanish and a better understanding of grammar.
I gained a basic understanding of Spanish grammar, vocab, and culture

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The course was very well organized and all work was clear. As the whole course was conducted online, I don't think it could have been done in a better way.

The professor was very open to meeting outside of class. She was available at different times, and thus; as a student I felt comfortable approaching her with any questions I had about the course material.

Online really does not work well for languages. I feel like we lost the heart of this course by only meeting three times a week over Zoom. It made it very difficult to get to know other students and speak for extended periods of time.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The discussion during online classes was evenly distributed between all students and everybody was able to contribute and develop speaking skills. Sharing screen enable playing Spanish content and presentations and the whole course was very user friendly.
This course used Breakout Rooms in an effective manner. The small conversations I had with other students in Breakout Rooms proved to be essential to my success in this course.

Virtual 3 times a week was not effective in my opinion. The Zoom breakout rooms just did not encourage good conversation amongst students, and 10-person Zoom rooms provide little time for individuals to speak. I don't know if there is a better way but I do not think this format was very successful.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes, I would recommend this course to another student as it offers a great pathway to developing your Spanish.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student because this course allows the student to interact with the Spanish language from different angles, angles that create a comprehensive understanding in L2.

Not if it's over Zoom. We did the best we could but to learn a language one needs to speak every day, and 3 time a week over Zoom did not deliver. Really fun course in general though, and I would definitely recommend in a normal year!

Make sure to take advantage of OHs and Center for Language Tutoring!

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Typical online spanish assignments on vhl central
